summary: It Takes A Group To Raise A Child
title: It Takes A Group To Raise A Child
body:
• Pairing: Min Yoongi x Kim Namjoon
  • Genre: Fluff, Angst
  • Warnings: homophobia, strong language, mentions of violence, abuse
  • Word count: 3.9k

A/N: Heyo guys, sorry this took so long.. Anyways, get ready for a bit of more angst and please pay attention to warnings, thank you. Also, tell me what you think! Feedback is always welcomed and needed cause I’m a needy hoe. And yes, Yeji is Naji’s mom and yes, I’m emoitional and yes, that last text was ironic as fuck and I hate me

part 1/ part 2/ part 3

Namjoon was playing a video game at one of his best friends’ house that Friday afternoon. Yeji –said best friend- was preparing food for the three little demons she had to take care of. Babysitting Jungkook, Jimin, and Taehyung was her job in her free time since the parents of all three of the tiny humans worked together and were away most of the time. She had raised those kids since they were born, and now Jimin (or Chimmy) and Taehyung (Tata for a very specific group of friends) were seven years old and Kookie was five. She adored them, and Namjoon with the rest of the group loved them too, but they were too proud to ever admit that. Except for Hoseok. He had no pride in the matter.

An hour or so later, and after the three balls of energy were asleep, Yeji sat on the carpet next to Namjoon and watched him as he played his game passionately. He had his excessively long brown hair on a ponytail to keep them from falling over his eyes, something that the rest of the group found hilarious. The door unlocked and Yoongi walked in, looking like a zombie. Namjoon felt his cheeks burning and the other boy stopped for a moment

“Hey” he mumbled and had to contain his smile at the sight of the boy’s hair “Didn’t know you’d be here”

Namjoon kept playing even though his mind was somewhere else entirely “Yeah, Yeji needed some help with the little ones”

She smiled evilly and then looked over at Yoongi “Go leave your stuff and wash your hands, food is ready in a bit” as soon as he left the room, she faced Namjoon “Please confess already”

“What?!” he exclaimed “No way!”

“Why not?” she smirked and tilted her head playfully

“Because I’m awkward and he’s being just a bit more comfortable around me and I don’t wanna screw that up”

“You do realize that he’s more comfortable because you’ve shown signs that you like him, right?”

“You can’t be so sure”

“Honey, I’ve known him since he was born. Literally. We’re living together for the last fifteen years. I know him better than he knows himself right now. I might be ten years older than you guys but I’m not old enough to be completely blind. And he spends most of the day here so he talks to me. Like, a lot”

That seemed to capture the boy’s attention “Did he say anything about me?”

She laughed “You’re crazy if you think that I’d betray my little bro like that”

He pouted “I’m pretty sure you told him everything I’ve ever said to you”

She gasped dramatically “How dare you question my loyalty? I haven’t said a word!”

They both laughed and Yoongi sat next to Namjoon with a long sigh after a few moments “What are we laughing about?” he asked tiredly

“Namjoon completely failing at this game” Yeji smiled and got up “Is anyone else coming?”

Yoongi looked up from his phone “Uh, I think Hobi is”

Yeji rolled her eyes “Of course he is”

“Oh, and I think Jin is coming too” added Namjoon without taking his eyes from the screen

She stared at them “I love it when you invite yourselves over”

They both smiled with puppy eyes that made her melt and drop her tough façade. She cursed fondly under her breath as she dragged them both into the kitchen to help her out preparing food for four very hungry teenagers.

 

***

“So, uh, in short, well, what I called you here for, uh-“

“Are you breaking up with me?” Yoongi cut him off

They were sitting at the small table at Yeji’s place, keeping an eye on the little ones even though they were still sleeping. The others had to go shopping, so they shouldn’t be back for at least another hour. Yoongi was wearing an oversized pink hoodie that he had stolen from Yeji, and Namjoon felt his soul leave his body when he saw him in it. He looked like a fluffy marshmallow with his cute black bed hair and pouty lips. One thing he absolutely loved about him was the way his lips pouted every time he talked, or how his eyes lit up when he asked something and the answer would surprise him even in the slightest. What he didn’t know, was that Yoongi absolutely adored his dimples. And his big ass eyes that gave him the feeling that they actually held stars in them, even though that wasn’t even possible. And he loved how clumsy he could get, especially when he got nervous about anything, or how his voice was raspy and deep in the morning, and how soft he sounded when humming his favorite songs, or how ridiculously good he looked in his big ass glasses

Namjoon looked at him completely lost “Wait, we’re already together?”

Yoongi blushed and lifted his hoodie so that it would cover his lower face up to his nose “What the fuck Joon, now I sound dumb and delusional”

“You sound dumb? I didn’t even know we were in a relationship!”

It had been months of levitating in that weird situation of unofficial dates and countless movie nights and infinite texts and secret looks and hidden smiles

“Dude, I thought we were just taking it slow, what did you expect me to think when you text me at three in the morning telling me you think about me and then you hold my hand and cook for me?”

Namjoon shrugged “That I’m a good friend?”

Yoongi threw his hands in the air “My boyfriend friend zoned himself for me, what the fuck is this”

“Wait, am I your boyfriend?!” Namjoon shouted

“Well, good question, I don’t even know anymore!” he shouted back

“So what do we do?” he asked as his cheeks were almost as red as Yoongi’s

“I don’t know dude, do you want to be my boyfriend?”

“Hell yeah, I do!”

“Great!”

“Cool!”

Yoongi’s phone started ringing and he quickly picked it up. Namjoon could feel his stomach tighten when he saw the exact moment Yoongi’s smile faded away, and his eyes lost their sparkle and became sad and scared. He brought his legs close to him as if to make himself smaller and he bit his lower lip

“Okay,” he said in a quiet tone, almost a whisper “Yes, I’m sorry” He shoved his phone into his pocket and stood up “I have to go”

“Is everything okay? You seem-“

“I’m fine, everything’s fine”

He was gone before Namjoon could even say anything. Yeji, Hoseok, and Jin came back shortly after, holding a bunch of plastic bags full of groceries. They began to put everything in the fridge when she noticed that a certain someone was missing

“Is Yoon sleeping already?”

“No, I think he went home,” he said as he was putting a jar of sauce on the shelf

She stopped moving and looked at him almost in terror “Did someone call him?”

He stopped too, not sure about why she was so worried suddenly “Yeah, he seemed upset after the call and he said he had to leave”

“Shit” she left the bag on the kitchen table “Fucking shit, how long ago did he leave?”

“I don’t know, an hour maybe? Why, what’s going on?” he had never seen her like this, cursing and looking like she was about to kill someone as she grabbed her jacket

“I’m driving you home, come on” she walked to the living room “Hoseok, Jin, you too guys, everyone go home”

“What’s happening?” Namjoon asked as he followed her “Did I do something wrong?”

All four of them got out of the house, Hoseok and Jin still out of place, not knowing what could have possibly happened to make Yeji look like that when they always knew her as calm and collected

“No honey, you did nothing wrong, but you guys really don’t want to be here when I get back and-“

“No!” Namjoon yelled “Tell me what’s going on” everyone stopped “I saw that he was scared and sad, but I didn’t do anything because I didn’t know what was happening. So tell me what we are worrying so much about”

She stared at him, and her eyes were suddenly filled with the same emotions as Yoongi’s were before he left “Telling you that, is not my decision to make” she said softly “The only thing you need to know, is that the more I stay here, the worse it gets. So please, please Namjoon, get in the car”

He clenched his jaw and got into the car, slamming the door. Hoseok and Jin lived closer than Namjoon, so they would go home by themselves since the sun was still up. Yeji started driving and the car was soon enough filled with silence and intense staring

“It’s my-“

“It’s not your fault Joonie,” she said before he could finish his sentence “He’ll have to talk about this at some point, but I can’t make him do it before he wants to, and I sure as hell can’t give him away like that”

“Is he in danger?”

She looked at him and exhaled as calmly as she could “I don’t know”

***

 

Namjoon had the biggest bags under his eyes that morning. He didn’t get any sleep, nor studied. Yoongi wasn’t answering his phone or his messages, and he was so worried that he almost started crying when he showed up at school, two hours late and even paler than usual. He ran towards him and hugged him tightly. He felt his hands touching softly his back, before pushing him away. He stepped back

“Namjoon!” he sounded tired “We can’t do this at school, people are going to talk”

He felt the anger burning in the pit of his stomach “Are you fucking kidding me?” he raised his voice “You leave as if someone died!”

“Please stop yelling” he whispered but Namjoon spoke almost over him

“Then Yeji acts like someone is going to kill you!” he kept going

“Namjoon please-“

“You don’t pick up your phone!”

“Nam-“

“You don’t answer my messages!”

“Please, I-“

“And you worry about what people will say? Really? That’s so fucking-“

“For fuck’s sake Namjoon, please stop!”

He yelled back, loudly enough to make half of the kids in the hall look at them. Namjoon remained silent, as he saw Yoongi’s eyes full of tears and his hands clenched in fists at his sides. His nose and cheeks were red. Was he already crying before getting there? He sighed and walked past him, followed by a very concerned Hoseok who whispered something between the lines of you really don’t know when to stop, do you? Jin approached him and patted his shoulder

“Did I fuck up?” he asked as he tried to spot his boyfriend leaving

“Would it be you if you hadn’t?”

***

Hoseok sat next to Namjoon when the bell rang. Yoongi was already in his seat, a few desks behind them, hood covering half of his face, his look glued to the ground, his backpack still untouched

“Is he okay?” Namjoon whispered to his friend

“I don’t know man; something really fucked up is going on with him”

He coughed “What the fuck do you mean?”

Hoseok caught his angry tone immediately “Chill yo tits, Romeo, I’m not saying he’s doing something wrong, but you seriously have to talk to him”

“I don’t think he even wants to talk to me”

“Are you kidding me?” he had to lower his voice before continuing “He’s dying to talk to you, but he’s scared. You haven’t ever raised your voice like that, and apparently, he’s pretty sensitive to that stuff”

“Wait… Did I scare him?”

Hoseok hit his forehead “Bitch, you didn’t scare him, you fucking terrified him. You almost scared me; you have no idea how you looked like when you yelled at him in the hallway. I was like, ready to jump out and drag him away, you looked furious”

Namjoon looked behind them, only to find Yoongi in the exact same position. He hadn’t moved an inch “Fine, I’ll talk to him when we’re over”

“You better be calm as fuck or I’ll seriously beat you up”

“You’re suddenly surprisingly fond of him, and you sound almost overprotective”

Hoseok looked at him dead serious “You’ll understand”

 

***

They were standing on campus, only the two of them, face to face. Yoongi was looking down, while Namjoon didn’t know what to do

“Can I-“

“I’m sorry I disappeared like that. I’m sorry Yeji made you worry even more. I’m sorry I didn’t answer your messages” he talked like a soldier “I’m sorry I raised my voice at you”

Namjoon froze. He sounded like a robot, like he was programmed to say something like that. He raised his hand to pat his head and he saw him stiffen, shutting his eyes and clenching his jaw, almost as he expected him to hit him

“What is happening to you, Yoongi?” he whispered

“Nothing that should concern you”

He turned around and tried to leave, but Namjoon held his left wrist. Yoongi literally hissed and let out a whimper that made Namjoon almost jump back. He quickly loosened his grip and rolled Yoongi’s sleeve up, revealing his bandaged arm, from his wrist, all the way to his elbow. He gasped softly

“Nothing that should concern me?” he asked, “Did you get into a fight?”

Yoongi smiled but his eyes were still filled with sadness “Something like that”

Namjoon sighed and kissed his wrist, making the other boy blush. He softly pulled him into a hug, and this time got to hold him for a while. Yoongi let himself get immersed by Namjoon’s body, feeling his scent overflow him. And he felt safe. Safer than he’d ever felt before. He smiled to himself secretly. Yeji would kill him if she could hear his thoughts 

***

They were sitting at a restaurant, both silent, for different reasons. Namjoon sighed and let his fork down

“Will you tell me what is going on?”

Yoongi was wearing a huge hoodie, one that almost reached his knees and with sleeves that reached under them. Under the hood, he wore a black hat and a mask that covered the majority of his face. Only his eyes were exposed, but the hat did a pretty good job at covering them too. The room was filled with noise from the other clients, but Yoongi didn’t say a word. Nor moved. He just stayed still, as if his life depended on it, as he did too often to not be worrying

“Yoon, I understand that you don’t want to talk about this, but this is getting out of hand. I’m worried about you”

At those words, Yoongi shook his head, still not talking. He faced the window next to them and Namjoon could see his hands shaking. Whatever he was caught up in, it was getting worse from the day that Yeji had left for her studies abroad. He was collapsing right in front of him, and he wouldn’t let him help him

“Yoongi” he captured his attention again “I can’t do this. I can’t let you hurt yourself like this. Ever since Yeji left, you’re always hiding, you miss school days, you cover yourself up as if that will make you invisible, and I really don’t know what to do. I can’t help you if you don’t let me. Just talk to me”

Silence once more. A few moments later, Yoongi took a napkin, being extra careful as to not let his hands show from under the thick fabric of the hoodie. He scribbled something and got up, leaving the restaurant without a single word. Namjoon rubbed his forehead before reading what was written on the napkin. ‘I’m sorry’. He stared at it for a bit, not knowing what to feel, or what that meant. He left some money on the table and ran out, searching for his boyfriend in the tiny crowd. It wasn’t hard to spot him; he always stood out to him. He was quick to follow him, but when he had the chance to reach him, a little bell rang in his head. And so, Kim Namjoon became the creepy guy who follows his boyfriend to see what the fuck is going on in that boy’s life.

They kept walking, Namjoon keeping a safe distance between them, not that the other boy would even turn around to make sure he wasn’t following him, who does that? Namjoon, apparently. A few minutes later, he stopped in front of a house. He stood at the door for at least five minutes before going in. Was that his house? It seemed well taken care of from the outside. Namjoon took a deep breath and walked to the entrance, determined to make that boy talk to him, even though he shouldn’t pressure him as Yeji had explicitly clarified before leaving. He couldn’t just let him destroy himself like that. He was about to knock on the door, when he heard a deep, raspy voice coming from inside. He couldn’t quite understand what he was saying, so he approached the window. Creepiness out of the roof at this point

“Where did you go,” the unknown man said

“Nowhere” Yoongi’s voice was weird, almost as if he had a terrible cold

“Did anyone see you?”

“No, no one saw me” he repeated

Namjoon heard something creaking, probably the man standing up from an old chair “Are you making fun of me, brat?”

“N-no sir” Yoongi’s voice cracked and his phone had the worse timing

The sound of an incoming message filled the room

“That faggot is texting you again?” he shouted

“Don’t call him that!” Yoongi yelled at him at full force, his voice distorted and broken

“Don’t raise your voice at me, you filthy fag!”

Namjoon had heard enough. He busted the door open, just in time to see the huge man ready to punch his boyfriend. He felt the world stop and his breath disappearing. Without a second thought, he ran as fast as he could, falling on the man, making him lose balance and fall on his side. He started groaning, and Namjoon could easily grasp the situation. He was completely drunk, he probably didn’t even see him coming and now he was half unconscious. Yoongi was pressed against the wall, looking at him in absolute terror. Namjoon didn’t even think twice before grabbing his hand and pulling him out of the house. He lifted him up easily and Yoongi wrapped his legs around his waist and arms around his shoulders as he rested his face on the crook of his neck

“Everything’s okay baby,” Namjoon said as he kept running, feeling Yoongi’s tears on his skin, thanking his decision to not drop the gym “I got you now”

He kept running, even when his legs hurt, even when his lungs were threatening to give up on him, even when his whole body became numb to everything except for Yoongi’s shaking body and tight grip. He finally reached Yeji’s place, which was their shelter. All of the boys basically lived there, mostly because Yeji loved that house and they didn’t want her to give it up just because she’d been gone for a while. And because they had three kids to take care of, something they couldn’t do at their houses. He rushed in and placed his boyfriend gently on the couch. Yoongi hesitantly let go of him and brought his legs close to his chest like he did every time he felt vulnerable and unsafe and hurt. Namjoon fell to his knees in front of him, gasping for air. He felt Yoongi’s hands on his shoulders

“Are you okay?” he asked softly

It had to be incredibly painful for him to talk and Namjoon cursed at himself for not understanding, for believing that Yoongi was getting caught in random fights. Who? Yoongi. How fucking stupid. Once he got a hold of his breathing again, he looked up at him. He could only see his eyes. He reached for his hood, but Yoongi held him

“Yoongi” he whispered “Remember that time when I was riding Jin’s bicycle? Remember when I was going too fast to come here faster and fell right outside the house? I fell flat on my face and was bleeding like crazy. Yeji was worried that I’d need stitches after that. Remember that I didn’t want you to see me like that?” Yoongi nodded silently “Remember what you said to me?” it was almost two years ago, but that memory was crystal clear in his mind

Yoongi didn’t answer for a while “I said that I’d love you no matter what scars you carry on you”

Namjoon smiled “And now I understand how important that sentence was and still is to you. So, Yoongi. Will you let me love you with all your scars?”

Yoongi kept holding his boyfriend’s hand for a bit longer, before letting go of him. Namjoon was careful in his next moves. He touched him lightly as if to not break him. He took off his hood, and then his hat. His bangs fell over his face, still hiding whatever Yoongi wanted to keep a secret so badly. He ran his fingers through his hair softly and reached behind his ears to remove his black mask. He took it off slowly, to reveal Yoongi’s face, making him tear up instantly. He hadn’t ever seen any human being so beat up in his whole life. His right cheekbone was swollen and almost black, his nose wasn’t broken by a miracle, his entire lower jaw was awfully bruised, his lips were full of tiny cuts and they had dried blood all over them. His neck had the shape of big hands around it, and he was pretty sure that it would continue even under the hoodie. He rolled up his sleeves to reveal more bruises and cuts from what he supposed were shards of glasses. He placed his forehead on Yoongi’s knees and tried, really tried not to cry, because fucking hell he couldn’t let Yoongi see him cry because of this. But how could he not? How could he not cry his heart out on his boyfriend’s hands when he had let him go through that alone? How could he keep his calm façade when he was faced with so much pain in the eyes of the one he loved so much? How could he not cry out apologies when he couldn’t be there for him after he had promised that he’d always protect him? He was trying to calm himself down when he felt Yoongi wrapping his arms around him as softly as he could, and pulling him in the most fragile hug he had ever felt

“I love you, Namjoon” he whispered. He felt him holding him carefully “With all of our scars” he continues “With all of our faults”

Namjoon smiled “I love you too”

“This seems like the proper timing for a kiss, but I doubt either of us would enjoy that”

part 1/ part 2/ part 3

[[MORE]]

Namjoon was playing a video game at one of his best friends’ house that Friday afternoon. Yeji –said best friend- was preparing food for the three little demons she had to take care of. Babysitting Jungkook, Jimin, and Taehyung was her job in her free time since the parents of all three of the tiny humans worked together and were away most of the time. She had raised those kids since they were born, and now Jimin (or Chimmy) and Taehyung (Tata for a very specific group of friends) were seven years old and Kookie was five. She adored them, and Namjoon with the rest of the group loved them too, but they were too proud to ever admit that. Except for Hoseok. He had no pride in the matter.

An hour or so later, and after the three balls of energy were asleep, Yeji sat on the carpet next to Namjoon and watched him as he played his game passionately. He had his excessively long brown hair on a ponytail to keep them from falling over his eyes, something that the rest of the group found hilarious. The door unlocked and Yoongi walked in, looking like a zombie. Namjoon felt his cheeks burning and the other boy stopped for a moment

“Hey” he mumbled and had to contain his smile at the sight of the boy’s hair “Didn’t know you’d be here”

Namjoon kept playing even though his mind was somewhere else entirely “Yeah, Yeji needed some help with the little ones”

She smiled evilly and then looked over at Yoongi “Go leave your stuff and wash your hands, food is ready in a bit” as soon as he left the room, she faced Namjoon “Please confess already”

“What?!” he exclaimed “No way!”

“Why not?” she smirked and tilted her head playfully

“Because I’m awkward and he’s being just a bit more comfortable around me and I don’t wanna screw that up”

“You do realize that he’s more comfortable because you’ve shown signs that you like him, right?”

“You can’t be so sure”

“Honey, I’ve known him since he was born. Literally. We’re living together for the last fifteen years. I know him better than he knows himself right now. I might be ten years older than you guys but I’m not old enough to be completely blind. And he spends most of the day here so he talks to me. Like, a lot”

That seemed to capture the boy’s attention “Did he say anything about me?”

She laughed “You’re crazy if you think that I’d betray my little bro like that”

He pouted “I’m pretty sure you told him everything I’ve ever said to you”

She gasped dramatically “How dare you question my loyalty? I haven’t said a word!”

They both laughed and Yoongi sat next to Namjoon with a long sigh after a few moments “What are we laughing about?” he asked tiredly

“Namjoon completely failing at this game” Yeji smiled and got up “Is anyone else coming?”

Yoongi looked up from his phone “Uh, I think Hobi is”

Yeji rolled her eyes “Of course he is”

“Oh, and I think Jin is coming too” added Namjoon without taking his eyes from the screen

She stared at them “I love it when you invite yourselves over”

They both smiled with puppy eyes that made her melt and drop her tough façade. She cursed fondly under her breath as she dragged them both into the kitchen to help her out preparing food for four very hungry teenagers.

 

***

“So, uh, in short, well, what I called you here for, uh-“

“Are you breaking up with me?” Yoongi cut him off

They were sitting at the small table at Yeji’s place, keeping an eye on the little ones even though they were still sleeping. The others had to go shopping, so they shouldn’t be back for at least another hour. Yoongi was wearing an oversized pink hoodie that he had stolen from Yeji, and Namjoon felt his soul leave his body when he saw him in it. He looked like a fluffy marshmallow with his cute black bed hair and pouty lips. One thing he absolutely loved about him was the way his lips pouted every time he talked, or how his eyes lit up when he asked something and the answer would surprise him even in the slightest. What he didn’t know, was that Yoongi absolutely adored his dimples. And his big ass eyes that gave him the feeling that they actually held stars in them, even though that wasn’t even possible. And he loved how clumsy he could get, especially when he got nervous about anything, or how his voice was raspy and deep in the morning, and how soft he sounded when humming his favorite songs, or how ridiculously good he looked in his big ass glasses

Namjoon looked at him completely lost “Wait, we’re already together?”

Yoongi blushed and lifted his hoodie so that it would cover his lower face up to his nose “What the fuck Joon, now I sound dumb and delusional”

“You sound dumb? I didn’t even know we were in a relationship!”

It had been months of levitating in that weird situation of unofficial dates and countless movie nights and infinite texts and secret looks and hidden smiles

“Dude, I thought we were just taking it slow, what did you expect me to think when you text me at three in the morning telling me you think about me and then you hold my hand and cook for me?”

Namjoon shrugged “That I’m a good friend?”

Yoongi threw his hands in the air “My boyfriend friend zoned himself for me, what the fuck is this”

“Wait, am I your boyfriend?!” Namjoon shouted

“Well, good question, I don’t even know anymore!” he shouted back

“So what do we do?” he asked as his cheeks were almost as red as Yoongi’s

“I don’t know dude, do you want to be my boyfriend?”

“Hell yeah, I do!”

“Great!”

“Cool!”

Yoongi’s phone started ringing and he quickly picked it up. Namjoon could feel his stomach tighten when he saw the exact moment Yoongi’s smile faded away, and his eyes lost their sparkle and became sad and scared. He brought his legs close to him as if to make himself smaller and he bit his lower lip

“Okay,” he said in a quiet tone, almost a whisper “Yes, I’m sorry” He shoved his phone into his pocket and stood up “I have to go”

“Is everything okay? You seem-“

“I’m fine, everything’s fine”

He was gone before Namjoon could even say anything. Yeji, Hoseok, and Jin came back shortly after, holding a bunch of plastic bags full of groceries. They began to put everything in the fridge when she noticed that a certain someone was missing

“Is Yoon sleeping already?”

“No, I think he went home,” he said as he was putting a jar of sauce on the shelf

She stopped moving and looked at him almost in terror “Did someone call him?”

He stopped too, not sure about why she was so worried suddenly “Yeah, he seemed upset after the call and he said he had to leave”

“Shit” she left the bag on the kitchen table “Fucking shit, how long ago did he leave?”

“I don’t know, an hour maybe? Why, what’s going on?” he had never seen her like this, cursing and looking like she was about to kill someone as she grabbed her jacket

“I’m driving you home, come on” she walked to the living room “Hoseok, Jin, you too guys, everyone go home”

“What’s happening?” Namjoon asked as he followed her “Did I do something wrong?”

All four of them got out of the house, Hoseok and Jin still out of place, not knowing what could have possibly happened to make Yeji look like that when they always knew her as calm and collected

“No honey, you did nothing wrong, but you guys really don’t want to be here when I get back and-“

“No!” Namjoon yelled “Tell me what’s going on” everyone stopped “I saw that he was scared and sad, but I didn’t do anything because I didn’t know what was happening. So tell me what we are worrying so much about”

She stared at him, and her eyes were suddenly filled with the same emotions as Yoongi’s were before he left “Telling you that, is not my decision to make” she said softly “The only thing you need to know, is that the more I stay here, the worse it gets. So please, please Namjoon, get in the car”

He clenched his jaw and got into the car, slamming the door. Hoseok and Jin lived closer than Namjoon, so they would go home by themselves since the sun was still up. Yeji started driving and the car was soon enough filled with silence and intense staring

“It’s my-“

“It’s not your fault Joonie,” she said before he could finish his sentence “He’ll have to talk about this at some point, but I can’t make him do it before he wants to, and I sure as hell can’t give him away like that”

“Is he in danger?”

She looked at him and exhaled as calmly as she could “I don’t know”

***

 

Namjoon had the biggest bags under his eyes that morning. He didn’t get any sleep, nor studied. Yoongi wasn’t answering his phone or his messages, and he was so worried that he almost started crying when he showed up at school, two hours late and even paler than usual. He ran towards him and hugged him tightly. He felt his hands touching softly his back, before pushing him away. He stepped back

“Namjoon!” he sounded tired “We can’t do this at school, people are going to talk”

He felt the anger burning in the pit of his stomach “Are you fucking kidding me?” he raised his voice “You leave as if someone died!”

“Please stop yelling” he whispered but Namjoon spoke almost over him

“Then Yeji acts like someone is going to kill you!” he kept going

“Namjoon please-“

“You don’t pick up your phone!”

“Nam-“

“You don’t answer my messages!”

“Please, I-“

“And you worry about what people will say? Really? That’s so fucking-“

“For fuck’s sake Namjoon, please stop!”

He yelled back, loudly enough to make half of the kids in the hall look at them. Namjoon remained silent, as he saw Yoongi’s eyes full of tears and his hands clenched in fists at his sides. His nose and cheeks were red. Was he already crying before getting there? He sighed and walked past him, followed by a very concerned Hoseok who whispered something between the lines of you really don’t know when to stop, do you? Jin approached him and patted his shoulder

“Did I fuck up?” he asked as he tried to spot his boyfriend leaving

“Would it be you if you hadn’t?”

***

Hoseok sat next to Namjoon when the bell rang. Yoongi was already in his seat, a few desks behind them, hood covering half of his face, his look glued to the ground, his backpack still untouched

“Is he okay?” Namjoon whispered to his friend

“I don’t know man; something really fucked up is going on with him”

He coughed “What the fuck do you mean?”

Hoseok caught his angry tone immediately “Chill yo tits, Romeo, I’m not saying he’s doing something wrong, but you seriously have to talk to him”

“I don’t think he even wants to talk to me”

“Are you kidding me?” he had to lower his voice before continuing “He’s dying to talk to you, but he’s scared. You haven’t ever raised your voice like that, and apparently, he’s pretty sensitive to that stuff”

“Wait… Did I scare him?”

Hoseok hit his forehead “Bitch, you didn’t scare him, you fucking terrified him. You almost scared me; you have no idea how you looked like when you yelled at him in the hallway. I was like, ready to jump out and drag him away, you looked furious”

Namjoon looked behind them, only to find Yoongi in the exact same position. He hadn’t moved an inch “Fine, I’ll talk to him when we’re over”

“You better be calm as fuck or I’ll seriously beat you up”

“You’re suddenly surprisingly fond of him, and you sound almost overprotective”

Hoseok looked at him dead serious “You’ll understand”

 

***

They were standing on campus, only the two of them, face to face. Yoongi was looking down, while Namjoon didn’t know what to do

“Can I-“

“I’m sorry I disappeared like that. I’m sorry Yeji made you worry even more. I’m sorry I didn’t answer your messages” he talked like a soldier “I’m sorry I raised my voice at you”

Namjoon froze. He sounded like a robot, like he was programmed to say something like that. He raised his hand to pat his head and he saw him stiffen, shutting his eyes and clenching his jaw, almost as he expected him to hit him

“What is happening to you, Yoongi?” he whispered

“Nothing that should concern you”

He turned around and tried to leave, but Namjoon held his left wrist. Yoongi literally hissed and let out a whimper that made Namjoon almost jump back. He quickly loosened his grip and rolled Yoongi’s sleeve up, revealing his bandaged arm, from his wrist, all the way to his elbow. He gasped softly

“Nothing that should concern me?” he asked, “Did you get into a fight?”

Yoongi smiled but his eyes were still filled with sadness “Something like that”

Namjoon sighed and kissed his wrist, making the other boy blush. He softly pulled him into a hug, and this time got to hold him for a while. Yoongi let himself get immersed by Namjoon’s body, feeling his scent overflow him. And he felt safe. Safer than he’d ever felt before. He smiled to himself secretly. Yeji would kill him if she could hear his thoughts 

***

They were sitting at a restaurant, both silent, for different reasons. Namjoon sighed and let his fork down

“Will you tell me what is going on?”

Yoongi was wearing a huge hoodie, one that almost reached his knees and with sleeves that reached under them. Under the hood, he wore a black hat and a mask that covered the majority of his face. Only his eyes were exposed, but the hat did a pretty good job at covering them too. The room was filled with noise from the other clients, but Yoongi didn’t say a word. Nor moved. He just stayed still, as if his life depended on it, as he did too often to not be worrying

“Yoon, I understand that you don’t want to talk about this, but this is getting out of hand. I’m worried about you”

At those words, Yoongi shook his head, still not talking. He faced the window next to them and Namjoon could see his hands shaking. Whatever he was caught up in, it was getting worse from the day that Yeji had left for her studies abroad. He was collapsing right in front of him, and he wouldn’t let him help him

“Yoongi” he captured his attention again “I can’t do this. I can’t let you hurt yourself like this. Ever since Yeji left, you’re always hiding, you miss school days, you cover yourself up as if that will make you invisible, and I really don’t know what to do. I can’t help you if you don’t let me. Just talk to me”

Silence once more. A few moments later, Yoongi took a napkin, being extra careful as to not let his hands show from under the thick fabric of the hoodie. He scribbled something and got up, leaving the restaurant without a single word. Namjoon rubbed his forehead before reading what was written on the napkin. ‘I’m sorry’. He stared at it for a bit, not knowing what to feel, or what that meant. He left some money on the table and ran out, searching for his boyfriend in the tiny crowd. It wasn’t hard to spot him; he always stood out to him. He was quick to follow him, but when he had the chance to reach him, a little bell rang in his head. And so, Kim Namjoon became the creepy guy who follows his boyfriend to see what the fuck is going on in that boy’s life.

They kept walking, Namjoon keeping a safe distance between them, not that the other boy would even turn around to make sure he wasn’t following him, who does that? Namjoon, apparently. A few minutes later, he stopped in front of a house. He stood at the door for at least five minutes before going in. Was that his house? It seemed well taken care of from the outside. Namjoon took a deep breath and walked to the entrance, determined to make that boy talk to him, even though he shouldn’t pressure him as Yeji had explicitly clarified before leaving. He couldn’t just let him destroy himself like that. He was about to knock on the door, when he heard a deep, raspy voice coming from inside. He couldn’t quite understand what he was saying, so he approached the window. Creepiness out of the roof at this point

“Where did you go,” the unknown man said

“Nowhere” Yoongi’s voice was weird, almost as if he had a terrible cold

“Did anyone see you?”

“No, no one saw me” he repeated

Namjoon heard something creaking, probably the man standing up from an old chair “Are you making fun of me, brat?”

“N-no sir” Yoongi’s voice cracked and his phone had the worse timing

The sound of an incoming message filled the room

“That faggot is texting you again?” he shouted

“Don’t call him that!” Yoongi yelled at him at full force, his voice distorted and broken

“Don’t raise your voice at me, you filthy fag!”

Namjoon had heard enough. He busted the door open, just in time to see the huge man ready to punch his boyfriend. He felt the world stop and his breath disappearing. Without a second thought, he ran as fast as he could, falling on the man, making him lose balance and fall on his side. He started groaning, and Namjoon could easily grasp the situation. He was completely drunk, he probably didn’t even see him coming and now he was half unconscious. Yoongi was pressed against the wall, looking at him in absolute terror. Namjoon didn’t even think twice before grabbing his hand and pulling him out of the house. He lifted him up easily and Yoongi wrapped his legs around his waist and arms around his shoulders as he rested his face on the crook of his neck

“Everything’s okay baby,” Namjoon said as he kept running, feeling Yoongi’s tears on his skin, thanking his decision to not drop the gym “I got you now”

He kept running, even when his legs hurt, even when his lungs were threatening to give up on him, even when his whole body became numb to everything except for Yoongi’s shaking body and tight grip. He finally reached Yeji’s place, which was their shelter. All of the boys basically lived there, mostly because Yeji loved that house and they didn’t want her to give it up just because she’d been gone for a while. And because they had three kids to take care of, something they couldn’t do at their houses. He rushed in and placed his boyfriend gently on the couch. Yoongi hesitantly let go of him and brought his legs close to his chest like he did every time he felt vulnerable and unsafe and hurt. Namjoon fell to his knees in front of him, gasping for air. He felt Yoongi’s hands on his shoulders

“Are you okay?” he asked softly

It had to be incredibly painful for him to talk and Namjoon cursed at himself for not understanding, for believing that Yoongi was getting caught in random fights. Who? Yoongi. How fucking stupid. Once he got a hold of his breathing again, he looked up at him. He could only see his eyes. He reached for his hood, but Yoongi held him

“Yoongi” he whispered “Remember that time when I was riding Jin’s bicycle? Remember when I was going too fast to come here faster and fell right outside the house? I fell flat on my face and was bleeding like crazy. Yeji was worried that I’d need stitches after that. Remember that I didn’t want you to see me like that?” Yoongi nodded silently “Remember what you said to me?” it was almost two years ago, but that memory was crystal clear in his mind

Yoongi didn’t answer for a while “I said that I’d love you no matter what scars you carry on you”

Namjoon smiled “And now I understand how important that sentence was and still is to you. So, Yoongi. Will you let me love you with all your scars?”

Yoongi kept holding his boyfriend’s hand for a bit longer, before letting go of him. Namjoon was careful in his next moves. He touched him lightly as if to not break him. He took off his hood, and then his hat. His bangs fell over his face, still hiding whatever Yoongi wanted to keep a secret so badly. He ran his fingers through his hair softly and reached behind his ears to remove his black mask. He took it off slowly, to reveal Yoongi’s face, making him tear up instantly. He hadn’t ever seen any human being so beat up in his whole life. His right cheekbone was swollen and almost black, his nose wasn’t broken by a miracle, his entire lower jaw was awfully bruised, his lips were full of tiny cuts and they had dried blood all over them. His neck had the shape of big hands around it, and he was pretty sure that it would continue even under the hoodie. He rolled up his sleeves to reveal more bruises and cuts from what he supposed were shards of glasses. He placed his forehead on Yoongi’s knees and tried, really tried not to cry, because fucking hell he couldn’t let Yoongi see him cry because of this. But how could he not? How could he not cry his heart out on his boyfriend’s hands when he had let him go through that alone? How could he keep his calm façade when he was faced with so much pain in the eyes of the one he loved so much? How could he not cry out apologies when he couldn’t be there for him after he had promised that he’d always protect him? He was trying to calm himself down when he felt Yoongi wrapping his arms around him as softly as he could, and pulling him in the most fragile hug he had ever felt

“I love you, Namjoon” he whispered. He felt him holding him carefully “With all of our scars” he continues “With all of our faults”

Namjoon smiled “I love you too”

“This seems like the proper timing for a kiss, but I doubt either of us would enjoy that”

They giggled exhausted, and that night, under the faint light of the full moon, alone in that familiar living room, they made a silent promise to love each other, even when it hurt to do so

Namjoon shrugged “That I’m a good friend?”

Yoongi threw his hands in the air “My boyfriend friend zoned himself for me, what the fuck is this”

“Wait, am I your boyfriend?!” Namjoon shouted

“Well, good question, I don’t even know anymore!” he shouted back

“So what do we do?” he asked as his cheeks were almost as red as Yoongi’s

“I don’t know dude, do you want to be my boyfriend?”

“Hell yeah, I do!”

“Great!”

“Cool!”

Yoongi’s phone started ringing and he quickly picked it up. Namjoon could feel his stomach tighten when he saw the exact moment Yoongi’s smile faded away, and his eyes lost their sparkle and became sad and scared. He brought his legs close to him as if to make himself smaller and he bit his lower lip

“Okay,” he said in a quiet tone, almost a whisper “Yes, I’m sorry” He shoved his phone into his pocket and stood up “I have to go”

“Is everything okay? You seem-“

“I’m fine, everything’s fine”

He was gone before Namjoon could even say anything. Yeji, Hoseok, and Jin came back shortly after, holding a bunch of plastic bags full of groceries. They began to put everything in the fridge when she noticed that a certain someone was missing

“Is Yoon sleeping already?”

“No, I think he went home,” he said as he was putting a jar of sauce on the shelf

She stopped moving and looked at him almost in terror “Did someone call him?”

He stopped too, not sure about why she was so worried suddenly “Yeah, he seemed upset after the call and he said he had to leave”

“Shit” she left the bag on the kitchen table “Fucking shit, how long ago did he leave?”

“I don’t know, an hour maybe? Why, what’s going on?” he had never seen her like this, cursing and looking like she was about to kill someone as she grabbed her jacket

“I’m driving you home, come on” she walked to the living room “Hoseok, Jin, you too guys, everyone go home”

“What’s happening?” Namjoon asked as he followed her “Did I do something wrong?”

All four of them got out of the house, Hoseok and Jin still out of place, not knowing what could have possibly happened to make Yeji look like that when they always knew her as calm and collected

“No honey, you did nothing wrong, but you guys really don’t want to be here when I get back and-“

“No!” Namjoon yelled “Tell me what’s going on” everyone stopped “I saw that he was scared and sad, but I didn’t do anything because I didn’t know what was happening. So tell me what we are worrying so much about”

She stared at him, and her eyes were suddenly filled with the same emotions as Yoongi’s were before he left “Telling you that, is not my decision to make” she said softly “The only thing you need to know, is that the more I stay here, the worse it gets. So please, please Namjoon, get in the car”

He clenched his jaw and got into the car, slamming the door. Hoseok and Jin lived closer than Namjoon, so they would go home by themselves since the sun was still up. Yeji started driving and the car was soon enough filled with silence and intense staring

“It’s my-“

“It’s not your fault Joonie,” she said before he could finish his sentence “He’ll have to talk about this at some point, but I can’t make him do it before he wants to, and I sure as hell can’t give him away like that”

“Is he in danger?”

She looked at him and exhaled as calmly as she could “I don’t know”

***

 

Namjoon had the biggest bags under his eyes that morning. He didn’t get any sleep, nor studied. Yoongi wasn’t answering his phone or his messages, and he was so worried that he almost started crying when he showed up at school, two hours late and even paler than usual. He ran towards him and hugged him tightly. He felt his hands touching softly his back, before pushing him away. He stepped back

“Namjoon!” he sounded tired “We can’t do this at school, people are going to talk”

He felt the anger burning in the pit of his stomach “Are you fucking kidding me?” he raised his voice “You leave as if someone died!”

“Please stop yelling” he whispered but Namjoon spoke almost over him

“Then Yeji acts like someone is going to kill you!” he kept going

“Namjoon please-“

“You don’t pick up your phone!”

“Nam-“

“You don’t answer my messages!”

“Please, I-“

“And you worry about what people will say? Really? That’s so fucking-“

“For fuck’s sake Namjoon, please stop!”

He yelled back, loudly enough to make half of the kids in the hall look at them. Namjoon remained silent, as he saw Yoongi’s eyes full of tears and his hands clenched in fists at his sides. His nose and cheeks were red. Was he already crying before getting there? He sighed and walked past him, followed by a very concerned Hoseok who whispered something between the lines of you really don’t know when to stop, do you? Jin approached him and patted his shoulder

“Did I fuck up?” he asked as he tried to spot his boyfriend leaving

“Would it be you if you hadn’t?”

***

Hoseok sat next to Namjoon when the bell rang. Yoongi was already in his seat, a few desks behind them, hood covering half of his face, his look glued to the ground, his backpack still untouched

“Is he okay?” Namjoon whispered to his friend

“I don’t know man; something really fucked up is going on with him”

He coughed “What the fuck do you mean?”

Hoseok caught his angry tone immediately “Chill yo tits, Romeo, I’m not saying he’s doing something wrong, but you seriously have to talk to him”

“I don’t think he even wants to talk to me”

“Are you kidding me?” he had to lower his voice before continuing “He’s dying to talk to you, but he’s scared. You haven’t ever raised your voice like that, and apparently, he’s pretty sensitive to that stuff”

“Wait… Did I scare him?”

Hoseok hit his forehead “Bitch, you didn’t scare him, you fucking terrified him. You almost scared me; you have no idea how you looked like when you yelled at him in the hallway. I was like, ready to jump out and drag him away, you looked furious”

Namjoon looked behind them, only to find Yoongi in the exact same position. He hadn’t moved an inch “Fine, I’ll talk to him when we’re over”

“You better be calm as fuck or I’ll seriously beat you up”

“You’re suddenly surprisingly fond of him, and you sound almost overprotective”

Hoseok looked at him dead serious “You’ll understand”

 

***

They were standing on campus, only the two of them, face to face. Yoongi was looking down, while Namjoon didn’t know what to do

“Can I-“

“I’m sorry I disappeared like that. I’m sorry Yeji made you worry even more. I’m sorry I didn’t answer your messages” he talked like a soldier “I’m sorry I raised my voice at you”

Namjoon froze. He sounded like a robot, like he was programmed to say something like that. He raised his hand to pat his head and he saw him stiffen, shutting his eyes and clenching his jaw, almost as he expected him to hit him

“What is happening to you, Yoongi?” he whispered

“Nothing that should concern you”

He turned around and tried to leave, but Namjoon held his left wrist. Yoongi literally hissed and let out a whimper that made Namjoon almost jump back. He quickly loosened his grip and rolled Yoongi’s sleeve up, revealing his bandaged arm, from his wrist, all the way to his elbow. He gasped softly

“Nothing that should concern me?” he asked, “Did you get into a fight?”

Yoongi smiled but his eyes were still filled with sadness “Something like that”

Namjoon sighed and kissed his wrist, making the other boy blush. He softly pulled him into a hug, and this time got to hold him for a while. Yoongi let himself get immersed by Namjoon’s body, feeling his scent overflow him. And he felt safe. Safer than he’d ever felt before. He smiled to himself secretly. Yeji would kill him if she could hear his thoughts 

***

They were sitting at a restaurant, both silent, for different reasons. Namjoon sighed and let his fork down

“Will you tell me what is going on?”

Yoongi was wearing a huge hoodie, one that almost reached his knees and with sleeves that reached under them. Under the hood, he wore a black hat and a mask that covered the majority of his face. Only his eyes were exposed, but the hat did a pretty good job at covering them too. The room was filled with noise from the other clients, but Yoongi didn’t say a word. Nor moved. He just stayed still, as if his life depended on it, as he did too often to not be worrying

“Yoon, I understand that you don’t want to talk about this, but this is getting out of hand. I’m worried about you”

At those words, Yoongi shook his head, still not talking. He faced the window next to them and Namjoon could see his hands shaking. Whatever he was caught up in, it was getting worse from the day that Yeji had left for her studies abroad. He was collapsing right in front of him, and he wouldn’t let him help him

“Yoongi” he captured his attention again “I can’t do this. I can’t let you hurt yourself like this. Ever since Yeji left, you’re always hiding, you miss school days, you cover yourself up as if that will make you invisible, and I really don’t know what to do. I can’t help you if you don’t let me. Just talk to me”

Silence once more. A few moments later, Yoongi took a napkin, being extra careful as to not let his hands show from under the thick fabric of the hoodie. He scribbled something and got up, leaving the restaurant without a single word. Namjoon rubbed his forehead before reading what was written on the napkin. ‘I’m sorry’. He stared at it for a bit, not knowing what to feel, or what that meant. He left some money on the table and ran out, searching for his boyfriend in the tiny crowd. It wasn’t hard to spot him; he always stood out to him. He was quick to follow him, but when he had the chance to reach him, a little bell rang in his head. And so, Kim Namjoon became the creepy guy who follows his boyfriend to see what the fuck is going on in that boy’s life.

They kept walking, Namjoon keeping a safe distance between them, not that the other boy would even turn around to make sure he wasn’t following him, who does that? Namjoon, apparently. A few minutes later, he stopped in front of a house. He stood at the door for at least five minutes before going in. Was that his house? It seemed well taken care of from the outside. Namjoon took a deep breath and walked to the entrance, determined to make that boy talk to him, even though he shouldn’t pressure him as Yeji had explicitly clarified before leaving. He couldn’t just let him destroy himself like that. He was about to knock on the door, when he heard a deep, raspy voice coming from inside. He couldn’t quite understand what he was saying, so he approached the window. Creepiness out of the roof at this point

“Where did you go,” the unknown man said

“Nowhere” Yoongi’s voice was weird, almost as if he had a terrible cold

“Did anyone see you?”

“No, no one saw me” he repeated

Namjoon heard something creaking, probably the man standing up from an old chair “Are you making fun of me, brat?”

“N-no sir” Yoongi’s voice cracked and his phone had the worse timing

The sound of an incoming message filled the room

“That faggot is texting you again?” he shouted

“Don’t call him that!” Yoongi yelled at him at full force, his voice distorted and broken

“Don’t raise your voice at me, you filthy fag!”

Namjoon had heard enough. He busted the door open, just in time to see the huge man ready to punch his boyfriend. He felt the world stop and his breath disappearing. Without a second thought, he ran as fast as he could, falling on the man, making him lose balance and fall on his side. He started groaning, and Namjoon could easily grasp the situation. He was completely drunk, he probably didn’t even see him coming and now he was half unconscious. Yoongi was pressed against the wall, looking at him in absolute terror. Namjoon didn’t even think twice before grabbing his hand and pulling him out of the house. He lifted him up easily and Yoongi wrapped his legs around his waist and arms around his shoulders as he rested his face on the crook of his neck

“Everything’s okay baby,” Namjoon said as he kept running, feeling Yoongi’s tears on his skin, thanking his decision to not drop the gym “I got you now”

He kept running, even when his legs hurt, even when his lungs were threatening to give up on him, even when his whole body became numb to everything except for Yoongi’s shaking body and tight grip. He finally reached Yeji’s place, which was their shelter. All of the boys basically lived there, mostly because Yeji loved that house and they didn’t want her to give it up just because she’d been gone for a while. And because they had three kids to take care of, something they couldn’t do at their houses. He rushed in and placed his boyfriend gently on the couch. Yoongi hesitantly let go of him and brought his legs close to his chest like he did every time he felt vulnerable and unsafe and hurt. Namjoon fell to his knees in front of him, gasping for air. He felt Yoongi’s hands on his shoulders

“Are you okay?” he asked softly

It had to be incredibly painful for him to talk and Namjoon cursed at himself for not understanding, for believing that Yoongi was getting caught in random fights. Who? Yoongi. How fucking stupid. Once he got a hold of his breathing again, he looked up at him. He could only see his eyes. He reached for his hood, but Yoongi held him

“Yoongi” he whispered “Remember that time when I was riding Jin’s bicycle? Remember when I was going too fast to come here faster and fell right outside the house? I fell flat on my face and was bleeding like crazy. Yeji was worried that I’d need stitches after that. Remember that I didn’t want you to see me like that?” Yoongi nodded silently “Remember what you said to me?” it was almost two years ago, but that memory was crystal clear in his mind

Yoongi didn’t answer for a while “I said that I’d love you no matter what scars you carry on you”

Namjoon smiled “And now I understand how important that sentence was and still is to you. So, Yoongi. Will you let me love you with all your scars?”

Yoongi kept holding his boyfriend’s hand for a bit longer, before letting go of him. Namjoon was careful in his next moves. He touched him lightly as if to not break him. He took off his hood, and then his hat. His bangs fell over his face, still hiding whatever Yoongi wanted to keep a secret so badly. He ran his fingers through his hair softly and reached behind his ears to remove his black mask. He took it off slowly, to reveal Yoongi’s face, making him tear up instantly. He hadn’t ever seen any human being so beat up in his whole life. His right cheekbone was swollen and almost black, his nose wasn’t broken by a miracle, his entire lower jaw was awfully bruised, his lips were full of tiny cuts and they had dried blood all over them. His neck had the shape of big hands around it, and he was pretty sure that it would continue even under the hoodie. He rolled up his sleeves to reveal more bruises and cuts from what he supposed were shards of glasses. He placed his forehead on Yoongi’s knees and tried, really tried not to cry, because fucking hell he couldn’t let Yoongi see him cry because of this. But how could he not? How could he not cry his heart out on his boyfriend’s hands when he had let him go through that alone? How could he keep his calm façade when he was faced with so much pain in the eyes of the one he loved so much? How could he not cry out apologies when he couldn’t be there for him after he had promised that he’d always protect him? He was trying to calm himself down when he felt Yoongi wrapping his arms around him as softly as he could, and pulling him in the most fragile hug he had ever felt

“I love you, Namjoon” he whispered. He felt him holding him carefully “With all of our scars” he continues “With all of our faults”

Namjoon smiled “I love you too”

“This seems like the proper timing for a kiss, but I doubt either of us would enjoy that”

They giggled exhausted, and that night, under the faint light of the full moon, alone in that familiar living room, they made a silent promise to love each other, even when it hurt to do so

She had raised those kids since they were born, and now Jimin (or Chimmy) and Taehyung (Tata for a very specific group of friends) were seven years old and Kookie was five. She adored them, and Namjoon with the rest of the group loved them too, but they were too proud to ever admit that. Except for Hoseok. He had no pride in the matter.

An hour or so later, and after the three balls of energy were asleep, Yeji sat on the carpet next to Namjoon and watched him as he played his game passionately. He had his excessively long brown hair on a ponytail to keep them from falling over his eyes, something that the rest of the group found hilarious. Namjoon kept playing even though his mind was somewhere else entirely “Yeah, Yeji needed some help with the little ones”

“You can’t be so sure”

“Honey, I’ve known him since he was born. Literally. We’re living together for the last fifteen years. I know him better than he knows himself right now. She laughed “You’re crazy if you think that I’d betray my little bro like that”

He pouted “I’m pretty sure you told him everything I’ve ever said to you”

She gasped dramatically “How dare you question my loyalty? I haven’t said a word!”

They both laughed and Yoongi sat next to Namjoon with a long sigh after a few moments “What are we laughing about?” he asked tiredly

Yoongi looked up from his phone “Uh, I think Hobi is”

“Oh, and I think Jin is coming too” added Namjoon without taking his eyes from the screen

She stared at them “I love it when you invite yourselves over”

“Great!”

“Cool!”

“Yoon, I understand that you don’t want to talk about this, but this is getting out of hand. I’m worried about you”

At those words, Yoongi shook his head, still not talking. He faced the window next to them and Namjoon could see his hands shaking. Whatever he was caught up in, it was getting worse from the day that Yeji had left for her studies abroad. He was collapsing right in front of him, and he wouldn’t let him help him

“Yoongi” he captured his attention again “I can’t do this. I can’t let you hurt yourself like this. Ever since Yeji left, you’re always hiding, you miss school days, you cover yourself up as if that will make you invisible, and I really don’t know what to do. I can’t help you if you don’t let me. Just talk to me”

Silence once more. A few moments later, Yoongi took a napkin, being extra careful as to not let his hands show from under the thick fabric of the hoodie. He scribbled something and got up, leaving the restaurant without a single word. Namjoon rubbed his forehead before reading what was written on the napkin. ‘I’m sorry’. He stared at it for a bit, not knowing what to feel, or what that meant. He left some money on the table and ran out, searching for his boyfriend in the tiny crowd. It wasn’t hard to spot him; he always stood out to him. He was quick to follow him, but when he had the chance to reach him, a little bell rang in his head. And so, Kim Namjoon became the creepy guy who follows his boyfriend to see what the fuck is going on in that boy’s life.

They kept walking, Namjoon keeping a safe distance between them, not that the other boy would even turn around to make sure he wasn’t following him, who does that? Namjoon, apparently. A few minutes later, he stopped in front of a house. He stood at the door for at least five minutes before going in. Was that his house? It seemed well taken care of from the outside. Namjoon took a deep breath and walked to the entrance, determined to make that boy talk to him, even though he shouldn’t pressure him as Yeji had explicitly clarified before leaving. He couldn’t just let him destroy himself like that. He was about to knock on the door, when he heard a deep, raspy voice coming from inside. He couldn’t quite understand what he was saying, so he approached the window. Creepiness out of the roof at this point

“Where did you go,” the unknown man said

“Nowhere” Yoongi’s voice was weird, almost as if he had a terrible cold

“Did anyone see you?”

“No, no one saw me” he repeated

Namjoon heard something creaking, probably the man standing up from an old chair “Are you making fun of me, brat?”

“N-no sir” Yoongi’s voice cracked and his phone had the worse timing

The sound of an incoming message filled the room

“That faggot is texting you again?” he shouted

“Don’t call him that!” Yoongi yelled at him at full force, his voice distorted and broken

“Don’t raise your voice at me, you filthy fag!”

Namjoon had heard enough. He busted the door open, just in time to see the huge man ready to punch his boyfriend. He felt the world stop and his breath disappearing. Without a second thought, he ran as fast as he could, falling on the man, making him lose balance and fall on his side. He started groaning, and Namjoon could easily grasp the situation. He was completely drunk, he probably didn’t even see him coming and now he was half unconscious. Yoongi was pressed against the wall, looking at him in absolute terror. Namjoon didn’t even think twice before grabbing his hand and pulling him out of the house. He lifted him up easily and Yoongi wrapped his legs around his waist and arms around his shoulders as he rested his face on the crook of his neck

“Everything’s okay baby,” Namjoon said as he kept running, feeling Yoongi’s tears on his skin, thanking his decision to not drop the gym “I got you now”

He kept running, even when his legs hurt, even when his lungs were threatening to give up on him, even when his whole body became numb to everything except for Yoongi’s shaking body and tight grip. He finally reached Yeji’s place, which was their shelter. All of the boys basically lived there, mostly because Yeji loved that house and they didn’t want her to give it up just because she’d been gone for a while. And because they had three kids to take care of, something they couldn’t do at their houses. He rushed in and placed his boyfriend gently on the couch. Yoongi hesitantly let go of him and brought his legs close to his chest like he did every time he felt vulnerable and unsafe and hurt. Namjoon fell to his knees in front of him, gasping for air. He felt Yoongi’s hands on his shoulders

“Are you okay?” he asked softly

It had to be incredibly painful for him to talk and Namjoon cursed at himself for not understanding, for believing that Yoongi was getting caught in random fights. Who? Yoongi. How fucking stupid. Once he got a hold of his breathing again, he looked up at him. He could only see his eyes. He reached for his hood, but Yoongi held him

“Yoongi” he whispered “Remember that time when I was riding Jin’s bicycle? Remember when I was going too fast to come here faster and fell right outside the house? I fell flat on my face and was bleeding like crazy. Yeji was worried that I’d need stitches after that. Remember that I didn’t want you to see me like that?” Yoongi nodded silently “Remember what you said to me?” it was almost two years ago, but that memory was crystal clear in his mind

Yoongi didn’t answer for a while “I said that I’d love you no matter what scars you carry on you”

Namjoon smiled “And now I understand how important that sentence was and still is to you. So, Yoongi. Will you let me love you with all your scars?”

Yoongi kept holding his boyfriend’s hand for a bit longer, before letting go of him. Namjoon was careful in his next moves. He touched him lightly as if to not break him. He took off his hood, and then his hat. His bangs fell over his face, still hiding whatever Yoongi wanted to keep a secret so badly. He ran his fingers through his hair softly and reached behind his ears to remove his black mask. He took it off slowly, to reveal Yoongi’s face, making him tear up instantly. He hadn’t ever seen any human being so beat up in his whole life. His right cheekbone was swollen and almost black, his nose wasn’t broken by a miracle, his entire lower jaw was awfully bruised, his lips were full of tiny cuts and they had dried blood all over them. His neck had the shape of big hands around it, and he was pretty sure that it would continue even under the hoodie. He rolled up his sleeves to reveal more bruises and cuts from what he supposed were shards of glasses. He placed his forehead on Yoongi’s knees and tried, really tried not to cry, because fucking hell he couldn’t let Yoongi see him cry because of this. But how could he not? How could he not cry his heart out on his boyfriend’s hands when he had let him go through that alone? How could he keep his calm façade when he was faced with so much pain in the eyes of the one he loved so much? How could he not cry out apologies when he couldn’t be there for him after he had promised that he’d always protect him? He was trying to calm himself down when he felt Yoongi wrapping his arms around him as softly as he could, and pulling him in the most fragile hug he had ever felt

“I love you, Namjoon” he whispered. He felt him holding him carefully “With all of our scars” he continues “With all of our faults”

Namjoon smiled “I love you too”

“This seems like the proper timing for a kiss, but I doubt either of us would enjoy that”

They giggled exhausted, and that night, under the faint light of the full moon, alone in that familiar living room, they made a silent promise to love each other, even when it hurt to do so

In the now empty clubroom, he reached up and caught the kiss before it could fly away to some other hopeless idiot with a crush and made his way back to his little desk, face aflame. Seokjin read his horoscopes. Kim Seokjin, senior president, business and food industry major, read Jimin’s horoscopes. Hyung’s one of your most loyal followers.

He tried to contain the burst of happy, raucous, exhilarating feeling in his chest, as if he’d swallowed a batch of fireworks, before Jimin muffled his giggling into the pillow on his chair and kicked his feet on the floor. After he’d worked through the initial unmitigated joy, an idea crept into Jimin’s mind.

(in which assistant editor Jimin manages the horoscope column in the university’s online newspaper, and after a fateful meeting with senior heartthrob and loyal reader seokjin, starts adding weirdly specific advice to the sagittarius sign about their soulmate)

title: BTS scenario → taking care of you when you’re on your period.
body:
pairing: bts x reader
fandom: bts
warnings: language ; mentions of sex ; mentions of blood (duh)
genre: fluff

a/n: yaaas. hope you like it bb!

ask box | masterlist | fandoms | faq | multifandom reader blog

kim seokjin

The first thing Jin did when you told him you wanted to stay in bed because of cramps, was walk into the kitchen and make you some tea that always helped him with cramps. Sure, the cramps you were having were probably different, but might be worth a try, right?

And with that and a softer blanket, he walked back into his bedroom, putting down the cup on the nightstand and draping the blanket over you, before he leaned down to kiss your temple.

“Drink the tea, Jagi. It’ll help.”

“Thank you,” you muttered into the pillow, barely even able to open your eyes because of how exhausted you were, but since he would have to leave in around five minutes for practice anyways, you would spend the day in bed, drinking his tea and sleeping.

And when he’d come home, you’d hopefully feel better.

min yoongi

“I don’t want to,” you whined, looking absolutely ridiculous with the blanket wrapped around your entire body, only your face being visible, “I want to go back to bed.”

“Stop whining, I’m doing this for you,” he sat you down on the couch, before he walked over to the piano, “Lie down and close your eyes.”

You were still pouting, but he did lean down to kiss you, so that was nice enough and that’s when you decided to do what he asked and just enjoy whatever he was doing for you.

You weren’t familiar with the melody he was playing a moment later, but it was absolutely beautiful.

A new song, perhaps? If it was, it must mean a lot to him, because you seldom heard him play like this.. like you could feel the emotions dance in the room.

Somewhere in the middle, you must have drifted off, the exhaustion of having your period taking over, because you definitely didn’t hear it when he turned around and looked at you with a smile, before saying: “It’s not done yet, but.. it’s about you. And it’s for you.”

jung hoseok

“Aw, what can I do?” he sat down on the bed next to you, his hand resting on your hip.

“First of all, change your sweatpants because I can see the outline of your dick and it’s making me horny,” that awful moment when all you want to do is have sex, but the blood coming out of your vagina is preventing you from doing so, or at least making it extremely unattractive, “Then, you can come back to bed and cuddle me all day long.”

He looked down at himself and started grinning, “Is it really?”

“Jung Hoseok,” you warned and he quickly ran into his closet to change, coming back a second later with another blanket to drape over your body and new sweatpants, before he laid down behind you and wrapped his arms around you, pulling you against his chest.

“Like this?”

“It’s perfect. Thank you,” you smiled like a little baby and felt as happy as one, despite the period pain.

kim namjoon

He hated having to work long hours when you felt this bad, but he made up for it by bringing you chocolate, sweets and a stuffed animal when he finally entered his bedroom.

But see, periods are fucking horrible and even though it was really sweet of him, your hormones were being bitchy today and so you suddenly started crying when you saw him come in with all of this, realizing once again how lucky you were to have him by your side.

“Baby, no,” he quickly knelt down in front of the bed, “Is it not the right chocolate?”

“No, it’s just,” you sobbed, trying to wipe away the tears, “I just love you so much and I don’t deserve you.”

“Oh, (Y/N),” he chuckled and joined you in bed, pulling you towards him and having to stop himself from laughing any louder at your sudden outburst.

But it was kind of cute.

park jimin

You had texted him an hour ago, asking him if he could come home early from his night out with the boys.

You usually didn’t do that, you were content with just being in his bed and all that, but your period was making you feel things and you were lonely and unhappy and just really needed your boyfriend by your side.

He hadn’t answered, but an hour later, he was carefully pushing open the door with a bouquet of flowers in his hand.

“Jagi? Are you still awake?”

“You came!”

“Of course,” he smiled happily and leaned down to press a kiss against your forehead, “I’ve got you flowers and chocolate and I’ll just change into something more comfortable and then we can cuddle.”

And the award for boyfriend of the year goes to…

kim taehyung

“Is it that bad?” he asked as he gently brushed his thumb over your cheekbone.

You had been having cramps all day long, but now it looked like you were at your worst, as the tears were already threatening to fall.

“I hate it so much.”

“I know,” he pulled you towards him, rubbing his hand over your back and trying to get you to be more comfortable.

And with his hands and the smell of his cologne, as well as his warmth against you, you did feel better in no time.

And when he ended up singing to you so that you could finally fall sleep? Well, let’s just say you’d never let him go again. He was a keeper.

jeon jeongguk

“Kookie, I have a problem,” you walked back into his bedroom, immediately wrapping all the blankets around you when you were in bed again, “I ran out of pads.”

“P..- Pads?” his eyes widened.

“Can you go to the store and get me some? I don’t think my cramps will let me walk more than ten meters right now.”

“Pads,” he repeated, gulping down hard, before he nodded, “R..- Right. Pads.”

But when your boyfriend was standing in front of the shelf twenty minutes later, he realized that it wasn’t just as easy as that. There were thin one, there were long ones there were ones for the night.. which did you need?!

title: Kim Seokjin (Jin):
body:
Jin | Suga | J-Hope | RM | Jimin | V | Jungkook

Seokjin is a Beta werewolf, and is in charge of supplying the pack with food. He prides himself on his cooking skills, and loves nothing more than hearing praises from the pack based on his cooking. His senses are sharper than even most werewolves, as he is the hunter of the group, so he needs heightened hearing to hear his prey. Because of his superior hearing, he can always hear his pack members, knowing who is there based solely on their breathing patterns. This also means that it’s impossible to hide things from the Beta, as he can always sense distress or discomfort within his pack. Seokjin isn’t the best with people, preferring jokes and humour rather than serious conversations, and so will often seek out one of the Omegas to approach the situation. But when the time comes when Seokjin needed to step up, he does so without a moment’s hesitation, and his pack always know they can count on him no matter what.

Seokjin as a wolf is very similar to Seokjin as a human. He is slow and calculating, always stopping to listen before continuing. He is the fastest wolf of the pack, always managing to catch his prey. He exudes a calming presence, and although he doesn’t know how to diffuse certain situations, he is always willing to sit and watch, as that often helps keep the other wolves calm. His influence over the pack is much greater than he thinks, and the solemn wolf is one of the strongest links in the pack.
